etymology.description: Pictogram: a tool (chisel/awl/spike) used to mark slaves and criminals; variants include 䇂 and 亲.
etymology.interpretation: An image of a sharp branding or engraving tool suggests cutting and marking, which later extended semantically to harsh, pungent qualities and to associated derivatives. It also serves as the name of the eighth Heavenly Stem in the traditional calendrical system.

examples.chinese: 这味药有点辛(這味藥有點辛)，不太适合孩子(不太適合孩子)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi yào yǒudiǎn xīn, bú tài shìhé háizi.
examples.english: This medicine tastes rather pungent/bitter and isn’t very suitable for children.

examples.chinese: 你这几天工作很辛苦(你這幾天工作很辛苦)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhè jǐ tiān gōngzuò hěn xīnkǔ.
examples.english: You’ve been working very hard these last few days.

examples.chinese: 今年的天干是辛(今年的天干是辛)，因此纪年写作辛丑(因此紀年寫作辛丑)。
examples.pinyin: Jīnnián de tiāngān shì xīn, yīncǐ jìnián xiězuò Xīnchǒu.
examples.english: This year’s Heavenly Stem is Xin, so the year is written as Xinchou.
